Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Are you really using JUnit during your developmen
 t?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=78838898

Scary to step into the discussion at this point.

But....

We test everything we can test. We strive for the goal that nothing 
ships without complete automated tests. As a Java shop, we use JUnit.

However, we do not use testing as a design tool. We use a spiral model 
built around testing and design and coding. Some code is written test 
first, some code is tested after it is written. All code is designed 
into the software structure before it is committed to source code. As 
long as the code is tested before it ships, we are confident that it 
works. But we do not do test first design.

Jim

-- 
James P. Gunderson, Ph.D.                Cognitive Systems Architect
